briefTitle: Effect of SPD422 on Platelet Lowering and Safety in Japanese Adults With At Risk Essential Thrombocythaemia

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Subjects must have previously been treated with a cytoreductive therapy and been intolerant or refractory to that therapy.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Subjects should not have any other underlying conditions or medications that would confound the study analysis or interact with the study medication.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Subjects Who Responded in Platelet Count
outcomeMeasures.description: A response was defined as platelet counts to \<600x10\^9/L across consecutive visits for at least 4 weeks following at least 3 months of treatment.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Subjects With at Least 50% Reduction in Platelet Count
outcomeMeasures.description: Subjects who achieved at least 50% reduction in platelet count from their baseline level across consecutive visits for at least 4 weeks and following 3 months of treatment.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Subjects With Normalization in Platelet Count
outcomeMeasures.description: Normalization was defined as platelet counts ≤400x10\^9/L across consecutive visits for at least 4 weeks following at least 3 months of treatment.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Subjects Who Responded in Platelet Count Whose Baseline Platelet Count Was ≥600x10^9/L
outcomeMeasures.description: A response was defined as platelet counts to \<600x10\^9/L across consecutive visits for at least 4 weeks following at least 3 months of treatment.

outcomeMeasures.title: Percentage of Subjects Who Responded in Platelet Count Whose Baseline Platelet Count Was <600x10^9/L
outcomeMeasures.description: A response was defined as platelet counts to \<600x10\^9/L across consecutive visits for at least 4 weeks following at least 3 months of treatment.
